com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.process

Class ReadInputStreamThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.AbstractThreadWithException
        • com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.process.ReadInputStreamThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    @FullyTested
public class ReadInputStreamThread
extends AbstractThreadWithException
    Used by Process2 to read STDOUT or STDERR streams from a child process. Normally, there is no need to use this class directly, or subclass it. The class Process2 uses this class internally. At first glance, using the term "InputStream" in the class name seems wrong. However, the output from the child process is captured in JDK as an input to the parent process.

    It is possible to customize the behavior of this class through subclassing and overriding Process2.createReadInputStreamThread(InputStream, ProcessOutputStreamSettings, String).

    Author:
    Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)
    See Also:
    Process2, getDataAsByteArr(), getDataAsString(Charset)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReadInputStreamThread

        public ReadInputStreamThread(InputStream inputStream,
                     ProcessOutputStreamSettings settings,
                     String streamName)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - handle to STDOUT or STDERR stream from child process
        settings - reference to stream settings
        streamName - description for stream, e.g., "STDOUT". This only for debugging.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if inputStream, settings, or streamName is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if streamName is empty or only whitespace

    • Method Detail

      • getStreamName

        public String getStreamName()
        Returns:
        retrieves the description for this child process output stream

      • getByteArr

        protected byte[] getByteArr()
        Copies all bytes from the byte buffer used to read the child process output stream. This method accesses the internal byte buffer in a thread-safe manner.
        Returns:
        new array with all bytes from internal buffer. Never null, but may be empty.
        See Also:
        getDataAsByteArr(), getDataAsString(Charset)

      • getDataAsByteArr

        public byte[] getDataAsByteArr()
        Retrieves a copy of all bytes read from the child proces output stream. This method is thread-safe, so it may be called while the child process is outputting data -- not yet terminated.
        Returns:
        new array with all bytes from internal buffer Never null, but may be empty.
        See Also:
        getDataAsString(Charset)

      • getDataAsString

        public String getDataAsString(Charset optCs)
        Retrieves a String created from all bytes read from the child process output stream. This method is thread-safe, so it may be called while the child process is outputting data -- not yet terminated.
        Parameters:
        optCs -
        • optional Charset to convert bytes to a String
        • if null, the result of Charset.defaultCharset() is instead used
        Returns:
        new String created from all bytes from internal buffer Never null, but may be empty.
        See Also:
        getDataAsByteArr()
